intro: Myriopus eulinae, commonly known as the narrow-leaved myriopus, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a bluish-green hue, and it is typically found in dry, sandy soils. Myriopus eulinae is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
